page.title: 08District Council Structure
page.content: The New Forest Rural District Council is an organisation which deals with the local government of the surrounding area of Lyndhurst. It is concerned with topics like Planning, Health, Housing and Leisure. They employ 850 people. Most of these workers do not live locally as the houses are too expensive in this area. The structure of the council starts off with the Parish Councils. In the urban areas they are called Town Councils. There are 14 Councillors, who are elected every 4 years. They help to improve their surrounding area. The District Councils are next, of which the New Forest Rural District Council is one. Their councillors are elected every 4 years and are not paid whereas the officers are paid but are not elected, they help the councillors .
